name: Arcadia Lodge

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: This ranks as the best B&B I've ever stayed at, and I've stayed at quite a few. The Arcadia Lodge is perched on a hill in the town of Russell, in the Bay of Islands. The views are truly amazing, with most (and perhaps all, but I'm not certain) of the rooms looking out to the water. The rooms - as well as the rest of the house - are exquisitely and tastefully decorated (I stayed in the Tautoru suite, which had a somewhat beachy feel, private deck, and excellent views). Great beds/bedlinens too....I slept like a log each night. My personal favorite was the Arcadia's main deck, which is perfect for sipping a glass of wine in the late afternoon sun. Finally, the owners, David and Brad, are very friendly, accomodating, and all-around great hosts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Russell is a much more attractive and low-key town than its more touristy sister across the water, Paihia. It feels islandy, with some quality restaurants, a few shops, a little museum, several other historical sights, access to all of the Bay of Islands water-related tours and sailing, as well as a nice beach. If you're looking for nightlife, you won't find it. However, if you're looking to relax in a beautiful spot, go to Russell and stay at the Arcadia Lodge. I certainly intend to return.
reviews.title: Delightful stay in a beautiful location!
Best B&B in Russell
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Arcadia Lodge!

reviews.title: Fantistic B&B in the heart of Russell
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable and well appointed and the attached deck had a fabulous view where we enjoyed a bottle of wine. Our hosts were extremely gracious and were very helpful in planning our trip. They arranged a wonderful trip on a sailboat (the Phantom) that was one of the highlights of our travels!

aka: Arcadia Lodge Russell, New Zealand - Bay Of Islands
description: Arcadia Lodge is an historic (c 1902) house with magnificent views of one of the most beautiful bays in New Zealand's Bay of Islands. The style of the lodge is simple and uncluttered, the atmosphere relaxed, the breakfasts healthy and made fresh using local ingredients. Five rooms, four en-suite, one with private, non-sharing bathroom. The large front deck looks out onto the bay, perfect for breakfast or a wine at the end of the day.
